title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes $10,000,000 to be appropriated for child care for certain military dependents for fiscal years 2004 through 2008. Child Care Assistance for Military Dependents is added to the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. The Secretary will provide grants to help eligible persons pay for child care services for dependents by eligible providers. A dependent is defined as an individual meeting specific criteria. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of a reserve component member serving on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. A member of the Armed Forces on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation, as determined by the Secretary of the military department concerned. A member of the Armed Forces on active duty for a military operation, responsible for caring for dependents residing at least 50 miles from the nearest military installation with child care facilities. A member of the Armed Forces on active duty for a military operation is responsible for caring for dependents residing at least 50 miles from the nearest military installation with child care facilities or programs funded by the Department of Defense. The term 'military operation' refers to specific operations like Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle, or any successor operation. This is applicable for grants under certain conditions. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary with required information, including details of the child care provider. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary with required information, including details of the child care provider who offers the services assisted by the grant. The provisions of this subchapter, other than section 658P, that apply to assistance provided under this subchapter shall not apply to assistance provided under this section. Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to change the appropriations under different sections.
